attributes.action: Grant NHS funding for the treatment of cranial abnormalities such as Plagiocephaly and Brachycephaly
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Cranial abnormalities such as Plagiocephaly and Brachycephaly, among others are becoming more common throughout the UK, with little or no effort being made to promote awareness.  The NHS does not currently offer funding for the treatment of the condition which can sometimes result in facial asymmetry.  The general consensus between healthcare professionals is that the condition will correct itself, but failure to do so would result in cranial surgery.  Surely it is more cost effective to offer a non-invasive corrective treatment rather than surgery, which in the long term can prove more costly and dangerous?
